*div1 type="summary"* *p*Nathaniel Cox to Austin, New Orleans, March 22, 1832. Concerning settlement with the Hawkins heirs.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="03-22-1832"> 22 March 1832*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col: Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir, I have perused with some attention you letter of the *date_mentioned n="01-30-1832">30 Jany */date_mentioned*last and think with you that the representatives of our lamented friend *person_mentioned*Hawkins */person_mentioned*has been sensurable, in the great neglect shown with regard to the *location_mentioned*Texas grant*/location_mentioned* but I have some reason to believe *person_mentioned*Col: John Thompson Mason*/person_mentioned* (now somewhere in the *location_mentioned*Mexican States*/location_mentioned*) has authority to divide *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*and settle all accounts. Until the fate of his mission is known I shall urge the *person_mentioned*representatives */person_mentioned*no farther but should I be mistaken, there is now here a *person_mentioned*relative */person_mentioned*who will visit you, and I presume be cloathed with full power to act— he will set out at any time that may be advised.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Carbajal*/person_mentioned* is still here but returns in a few days with quite a small venture, having failed in making any collection from *person_mentioned*Mr Bowie*/person_mentioned* as contemplated It affords me great pleasure to find his conduct has been such as to gain your Esteem*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Nath: Cox.*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
